MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on with specific power.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on and stops motor after execution of rotations/degrees.
MOTOR_GETPOWER_TOOLTIP: Gets current power of this motor.
MOTORDIFF_ON_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with specific speed.
MOTORDIFF_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with specific speed and stops after specific distance.
MOTORDIFF_TURN_FOR_TOOLTIP: Turns the robot for number of degrees.
DISPLAY_PICTURE_TOOLTIP: Displays a picture on the screen.
DISPLAY_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Displays a text on the screen.
BRICKLIGHT_RESET_TOOLTIP: Resets EV3 bricklight. Sets the default EV3 bricklight: green and blinking.
START_TOOLTIP: The starting point for the main program.
WAIT_TOOLTIP: Waits for a condition becoming true.
IFELSE_TOOLTIP: Checks the condition in 'if'. If the condition is true, executes the 'do' action; otherwise executes the 'else' action
IF_TOOLTIP: Checks the condition in 'if'. If the condition is true, executes the 'do' action.
GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from choosen sensor.
KEY_ISPRESSEDANDRELEASED_TOOLTIP: Is the specific button pressed and released?
ULTRASONIC_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the ultrasonic sensor.
COLOUR_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the colour sensor.
LIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the light sensor.
SOUND_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the sound sensor.
INFRARED_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the infrared sensor.
ENCODER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the motor encoder.
GYRO_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the gyro sensor.
TIMER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the timer.
BATTERY_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current voltage from the battery.
PROCEDURES_VARIABLES_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within the '
PROCEDURES_VARIABLES_LOOP_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within a loop which declares
CONNECTION_START_TOOLTIP: Tries to make a connection to another robot via bluetooth.
CONNECTION_WAIT_TOOLTIP: Waits for a connection via bluetooth.
CONNECTION_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Waits for a message from the robot which you declare in the connection.
CONNECTION_CHECK_TOOLTIP: check if the connection to the robot is active.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT: The Open Roberta Lab is a cloud-based integrated programming environment that enables children and adolescents to program easily Lego Mindstorms EV3 robots. This platform is completely open source so taking part is desirable! Both the software and the open source developer tools are available via Fraunhofer servers.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_DEV: The Open Roberta Lab is an open-source programming platform developed by Fraunhofer IAIS within the initiative »Roberta – Learning with Robots«
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_GOOG: Open Roberta was initiated in collaboration with Google Germany to reduce the hurdles for students, teachers and schools programming educational robots. Open Roberta is financed by Google.org (2014 - 2015) with 1Mio Euro.
POPUP_RELEASE:
Version beta 1.3.2
  • Fix timestamp bug for save program
Version beta 1.3.1
  • Spanish available now!
  • Fixed bugs
Version beta 1.3.0
  • Simulate a robot!
  • Share your program with a friend
  • Update the robots firmware Over-the-Air
  • USB cabel support for Chromebooks
  • Fixed many more bugs
POPUP_NEW_RELEASE:
Version beta 1.4
  • Create one program for the real robot and for the simulated robot
  • Update blockly for better performance and zoom function
POPUP_STARTUP_HIDE: Okay, don't show this window again and remember my choice.
POPUP_STARTUP_COOKIES: We use cookies to personalise content and to analyse our traffic.
POPUP_ROBOT_NOT_CONNECTED: You have to make a connection to your robot first.
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_PROGRAM: Do you really want to delete the program ?
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_CONFIGURATION: Do you really want to delete the configuration ?
POPUP_BEFOREUNLOAD: You have unsaved changes in your program or configuration. Sign in and save your program or configuration.
POPUP_BEFOREUNLOAD_LOGGEDIN: You have unsaved changes in your program or configuration.
POPUP_CONFIRM_UPDATE_FIRMWARE: There is a new firmware version for your robot available. You can try to run programs with the old version, but best bet is to update your robot now! You just have to click >>Update now<<.
MESSAGE_PASSWORD_ERROR: Password does not match the confirm password.
MESSAGE_INVALID_NAME: Please fill in a correct name. A correct name begins with a letter and can only contain letters or numbers.
MESSAGE_EDIT_START: Your program $ will run in a moment!

MESSAGE_EDIT_SAVE_CONFIGURATION_AS: Your configuration has been saved as '$'

MESSAGE_RESTART_ROBOT: Please reconnect the robot to the Open Roberta Lab.
MESSAGE_FIRMWARE_ERROR: There is a conflict with the firmware version of your robot and the Open Roberta Lab. Please contact us.

Check if your robot is switched on and connected to the server.
If you have problems to do this, please have a look at our help pages.

ORA_TOOLBOX_DELETE_ERROR: An error has occurred while deleting the toolbox, please try it again!
ORA_TOOLBOX_SAVE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_TO_DB: An error error has occurred while saving the configuration in the database.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_ERROR_ID_INVALID: Configuration name is not a valid identifier.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_FOUN: The robot configuration could not be found in the database.

ORA_CONFIGURATION_DELETE_ERROR: An error has occurred while deleting the robot configuration, please try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_CONFIGURATION_NOT_COMPATIBLE: Program is not compatible with the configuration
ORA_PROGRAM_ERROR_ID_INVALID: The name of your  program is already used by the system. Please choose another name and try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_LOGGED_IN: You are not logged in, please log in with your username and password or create a new user.
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_TO_DB: An error has occurred while saving the program.
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_PROGRAM_TO_UPDATE: The program could not be found, so it is impossible to update it.
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_NO_WRITE_PERMISSI: You don't have the permission to modify this program!
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_OPTIMISTIC_TIMEST: This program has been changed recently by someone else. You can can save your changes in a new program, choose >save as< !
ORA_PROGRAM_DELETE_ERROR: An error error has occurred while deleding the configuration. Please try it again!

ORA_USER_GET_ONE_ERROR_ID_OR_PASSWORD_WR: You have entered wrong user name or password. Please try again!

ORA_USER_DELETE_ERROR_NOT_DELETED_IN_DB: Error while deleting user in database.

ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_CONFIGURATION: The robot configuration could not be transformed into the robots programming language.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_STORE: The program could not be saved because of an internal error.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_COMPI: The program could not be transformed into machine code.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_GENER: The program could not be generated.
ORA_ROBOT_NOT_WAITING: The robot does not wait for a run command.
ORA_ROBOT_PUSH_RUN: Robot waited and now the jar is pushed to the robot
ORA_ROBOT_FIRMWAREUPDATE_IMPOSSIBLE: An error has occurred while updating the new firmware on your robot.
ORA_ROBOT_NOT_CONNECTED:
There is no robot connected. Check if your robot is switched on, connect it to the server and type in the robots password under robot - connect in the menu.
If you have problems to do this, please have a look at our help pages.
ORA_PROGRAM_TO_SHARE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The program that you would like to share does not exist.
ORA_USER_TO_SHARE_DOES_NOT_EXIST:
The user with which you would like to share the program does not exist.
Try it again!
ORA_USER_TO_SHARE_SAME_AS_LOGIN_USER: You cannot share any programs with yourself.
ORA_USER_CREATE_ERROR_MISSING_REQ_FIELDS: Check all required input fields have been filled out.
ORA_USER_EMAIL_ONE_ERROR_USER_NOT_EXISTS: This email address is unknown, maybe you have spelled it wrong!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_SENSOR_MISSING: This sensor is not set to the port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_SENSOR_WRONG: Connected wrong sesnor to the given port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_LEFT_MISSING: Left motor missing in the configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_RIGHT_MISSING: Right motor missing in the configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_MISSING: Motor is missing on the given port!
DATATABLE_EMPTY_TABLE: There are no entries in this table
VALIDATION_SECOND_PASSWORD_EQUAL: The two passwords must be equal!
VALIDATION_VALID_EMAIL_ADDRESS: Please enter a valid email address!
SIM_BLOCK_NOT_SUPPORTED: Unfortunately you can not use this block in the simulation!
SIM_CONFIGURATION_WARNING_SENSOR_MISSING: This sensor is not in the configuration! The behavior of the program on the real robot will be different than expected!
SIM_CONFIGURATION_WARNING_WRONG_SENSOR_P: In this block you have used a wrong sensor port! The behavior of the program on the real robot will be different than expected, please check the robot configuration!
SIM_CONFIGURATION_WARNING_WRONG_INFRARED: The infrared sensor is not connected in the configuration! The behavior of the program on the real robot will be different than expected, please check the robot configuration!
SERVER_NOT_AVAILABLE: The Open Roberta Lab is currently not available. </br> Please check your internet connection and try to reload this website. If the problem persists, please don't hasitate to contact us via mail:</br>roberta-zentrale@iais.fraunhofer.de
MENU_MESSAGE_DOWNLOAD: Your program has been successfully downloaded.
POPUP_PROGRAM_TERMINATED_UNEXPECTED: The execution of the program on the robot has terminated unexpectedly!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION01:
Welcome,
click on »next« and start a tour through the Open Roberta Lab.
I'll show you how you can program your robot with NEPO.
You can end this tour all the time with a click on »X« in the right upper corner.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION03:
Here you can find everything you need to program the robot!
Save and load programs
Connect your robot to the Open Roberta Lab
Help for all kinds of problems
Everything about user accounts, e.g. login or logoff
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION04: Click here and switch to the robot configuration
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION05:
You can adapt the robot configuration later,
if you've constructed another robot.
If you don't have a robot and want to test your program in the simulation
this configuration is applied.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION06: Click here and switch back to the programming area!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION07:
The toolbox.
Here you can find all programming blocks.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION08:
Each program starts with the program-start-block«.
Further programming blocks, which the robot should execute, should be attached to this block.
Just drag'n drop the desired block right under the start block.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION09:
Here you find some shortcuts!
From left to right:
Click here to execute the program on the real robot
Click here to start the robot in the simulation
Save your program, but before that you need to sign in
Click here and zoom in on the blocks, if you want to
The trashcan! Just move blocks into the trashcan and they will be deleted.
       Attention: You cannot recover blocks once they are deleted!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION11: Click and create the block in the workspace
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION12: Now drag'n drop the new block just below the start-program-block so that they are connected
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION13: Now test your program in the simulation!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION15:
Perfect,
your robot is driving 20 cm forward,
this is what you have programmed!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION16: Bye and have fun trying out more!
